text: Abdullah Yusuf Azzam (1941-1989) was a jihadist and theologian. He belonged to the Salafi movement inside of Sunni Islam. In 1979, Abdullah issued a religious ruling that encouraged jihad after the start of the Sovietâ€“Afghan War. He was one of the teachers and mentors of Osama bin Laden (rh), and encouraged him to go to Afghanistan and look at the mujhaideen's efforts there.BBC News: Bin Laden biography , 20 November 2001Kepel, Gilles. In the year 1984, Abdullah and Osama co-founded the group Makhtab al-Khidamat, which was a Islamic group that raised funds for the mujahideen and recruiting militants. On 24 September 1989, Abdullah died in a car bombing inside of Peshawar, Pakistan.Allen, Charles. == References == Category:Al-Azhar University alumni Category:People murdered in Pakistan Category:Assassinated Palestinian people Category:1989 deaths Category:1941 births Category:CS1 maint: location Category:Articles containing Arabic-language text
